definition[0]: a place where something can be safely kept
definition[1]: an organization where the formal documents showing who owns shares, bonds, etc can be kept safely
example[0]: The bank will serve as a depository for the shares during the takeover battle
definition[2]: a place where goods can be kept safely
definition[3]: statements and EVIDENCE prepared for use in a court case
example[2]: The case depository — nearly 20,000 pages of evidence — was to be stored at Mr Petrone’s law offices.
